website_summaries.verdict: A reasonable pick if grain-free isn't important to you and you are looking for a well-balanced mid-level food.
pros: A mid-range price with a formula that includes antioxidants and amino acids
No artificial preservatives, flavors, or colors
cons: Kibble pieces are somewhat large and may be difficult for some cats to chew
Some cats experience stomach upset after eating it

customer_reviews.title: Just lost a long time customer
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying Hill's Science Diet for years. Initially, I bought the sensitive stomach type when I got a kitten with digestive issues. When those issues cleared up and the cat was all grown up, I switched to this indoor formula. No issues until the most recent bag. My cat has been vomiting several times a day ever since he started eating out of the new batch. I tossed it and asked for a refund. I'm switching brands.
customer_reviews.author: Cin

customer_reviews.title: Nothing like having to clean up orange barf everywhere everyday
customer_reviews.text: Both our indoor cats are throwing up daily after eating this food. Nothing like having to clean up orange barf everywhere everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Waddle

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely incredible
customer_reviews.text: When the vet saw my cat's coat, he wanted me to tell him what I was feeding my cat, so he could switch his cat to the same food. And this isn't the best thing about this food. My cat's litter tends to smell very strongly with any other food we've tried, and with this one, the problem disappears.
customer_reviews.author: amichay oren

customer_reviews.title: Is this formula new as well as the label?
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this formula for a few years now. This last bag has a different label but is supposed to be same formula. I have 3 cats. One is throwing this up everyday. The other two were initially still interested in this food but have now turned their noses up and leave the food in their bowls. They used to devour this food. I am so disappointed and now have a 15.5 lb bag of food no cat will eat. This is a great disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Lyons

customer_reviews.title: The best cat food on the market.
customer_reviews.text: I have a self feeder for 2 adult cats- one of which is a Ragdoll (who is a pig-a-saurus) and a kitten and this is the perfect cat food. . My cats are extremely healthy, the perfect weight, and they literally never throw up. Being that they always have access to food I was worried that my Ragdoll would overeat and become unhealthy, but I am very happy to say that its not the case at all. I go through a bag a month and I have a subscription to keep it coming. This is not the cheapest cat food on the market but I will tell you what, it is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Stead

customer_reviews.title: Made my cat sick.
customer_reviews.text: As soon as my cat started eating this food she started throwing up all over the house. I gave it a few days and there was no improvement. Went back to her old food and she’s fine.
customer_reviews.author: Farmgirl

customer_reviews.title: Fake food!
customer_reviews.text: This is not the product i ordered. The bag is the same, but the food inside is NOT hill science diet. My cat has been eating this for years so I know what it looks like! The fake stuff is noticeably bigger and my cat can barely eat it. The food I'm comparing it to is the exact same brand that i just bought from pet smart. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: josephual simpson

customer_reviews.title: Upset cats stomach
customer_reviews.text: I had my cats on the weight management food for a couple months. When I began to switch over to this one of my cats started puking after every meal and then just stopped eating altogether. I had to switch back to weight management just so he'd start eating again and it took about 2 weeks before he was eating as much as he used to. Had no issues with the other cat although she preferred the taste of the weight management and would try to eat other cats food so unfortunately I had to throw away the entire bag. Really disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cats got sick on this food
customer_reviews.text: This has made all 4 of my cats sick. Ever feeding I noticed they ate less and less. Then vomiting. Vet appoinment for one of them today even.
customer_reviews.author: emtmbb

customer_reviews.title: Size. Did I get dog food? My poor cats jaw!!
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered my cat this food a couple of times. The first batch I thought were too big of a kibble. The second seemed like the right size kibble for a cat. I bought this bag and it's big kibble again. My cat doesn't enjoy eating food that is so big. He most times tries to eat the other cats food, who is on a special diet. Why are the kibble so damn big? I've had cats and I've had dogs. This food that is marketed for cats is dog food in my opinion. Not satisfied. Hills was recommended, but I will try something that I can get consistent kibble, smaller sizes of.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley

customer_reviews.title: No more gas or runs!!
customer_reviews.text: FINALLY my cat doesn't have diarrhea. We tried several different foods and even powder probiotics and nothing helped till trying this food. His bowel movements are firm again and no more gas!
customer_reviews.author: mary ormiston

customer_reviews.title: Pieces are too large
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because it was time to switch my one year old cats from kitten food to adult food. I'm very disappointed with this product because of the size of the morsels - they're at least 3x as big as the food they were eating as kittens and therefore difficult for the cats to chew. I won't be purchasing again. In the photo, the piece on the left is the previous food the piece on the right is the science diet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cat gets sick
customer_reviews.text: My cat puked. Normally his puke has a hairball in it. This was just orange food puke. I won't mess around with this. Strangely, he went to the stuff like a crack addict.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Our cat could not keep this stuff down
customer_reviews.text: First off, the bits of this food are huge to the point where I worried about the choking hazard. Second, our male cat that eats almost anything (lemons, lettuce, anything he can try to steal from our plates when we're not looking) vomited every time he ate this food. Too low of protein for the money. We moved on to Purina Pro Plan and have had great luck.
customer_reviews.author: LMS

customer_reviews.title: The cat's meow.
customer_reviews.text: So originally I was skeptical, I hadn't heard much good about Hills. But my vet recommended it for my indoor cat, so I agreed to try. She came to me with long hair, but not much shine. She's been on this food for 2 years now, and she's gorgeous. She has a soft, shiny coat and great teeth. She loves her Hills and comes running when the bag is delivered. The UPS driver is her favorite now because he brings her "yummies." I can't say enough good about this food. If you want a brand that will keep your cat healthy and happy for years to come, I recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: E&E0715Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: One actually likes this food.
customer_reviews.text: I have one cat on prescription food for kidney issues and one of the other younger cats kept stealing her food when she would walk away. So I thought I would try to get them their own non-prescription food. Of course they would not touch the wet food but this dry food they seem to like. I find it hysterical how one formal feral and two rescue cats can become sooo uppity with their food palate. Thankfully the formal feral, that now has kidney issues, doesn't turn her nose up at the Hill's prescription food.
customer_reviews.author: NatalieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Cat can't eat
customer_reviews.text: Bigger pieces than what I buy at Petsmart. Cat has been vomiting for 2 days. Will only buy from Petsmart from now on.
customer_reviews.author: A R

customer_reviews.title: The pieces are too difficult for cats to eat
customer_reviews.text: As some other people have commented, the dry pieces for the adult formula are huge. My cat can't eat them and has thrown up several times in the weeks that I've gotten this. I gradually transitioned her to this food (I'd previously used their indoor kitten recipe) over a period of WEEKS but it didn't seem to help. I don't think these pieces are suitable for kittens, maybe dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Ally

customer_reviews.title: There is something wrong with this food
customer_reviews.text: I see why all the other reviews say something about this food making their cats sick. I’ve been giving science diet to my cats n dogs and I’ve never had a problem, until I bought this bag. I already took my cats to the vet and they even did blood work and there wasn’t anything wrong with them but the kept vomiting.
customer_reviews.author: Afr

customer_reviews.title: Food appeared to make my cat throw up.
customer_reviews.text: Cat threw up Hill’s Science Adult Cat food (Indoor version), which I had switched her to. I noticed the kiblets were large in the Indoor version (she tried to bite these to cut them up before eating them). Our cat really liked Hills Original version of the Adult cat food, and to which I have switched her to.
customer_reviews.author: JimO

customer_reviews.title: My cat vomits every day!
customer_reviews.text: Although i am all time Science Diet user, i am extremely disappointed by this product. It made my cat vomit almost every day! I was using light version of Science diet and she was pretty happy about it.
customer_reviews.author: dilshaadtd

customer_reviews.title: Cat stopped wanting to eat her food when I bought this 15 pound bag
customer_reviews.text: I think a omething is wrong with this batch. My cat has been happily eating this food for a year, and when I got a 15 pound bag in late January, she stopped eating it and keeps trying to go for our other cat’s prescription food. It was always the reverse of having to stop the other cat from eating her Hill’s Indoor Adult food, but neither of them want it.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Attanasio

customer_reviews.title: Cats hate it. Kibble size is way too big.
customer_reviews.text: Switched to this because my cats are always puking on cheap food. They continue to puke just as often except now they cry all the time because they hate this food. 4 cats and none of them want this. The kibble size is also huge, more sized for a large breed dog than a cat. Possibly that's the issue and not that the cats hate the taste. Has a strong fish smell. Expensive for how much they dislike it.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Increased hairballs
customer_reviews.text: So I had high hopes for this product and my cat seemed to like it okay... after two months of using though I can safely say his hairballs have increased from once every 6 months or longer, to once a week! Very unsatisfied with this and still have a large bag leftover. We are switching to a new brand right away.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: If you like cleaning up cat barf this is the food for you
customer_reviews.text: In 2013-2014 I used this food for my cat and stopped using it for the past 6 years for no particular reason. Now all of a sudden this cat food causes my cat (the same one from 6 years ago) to vomit at least 2-3 times a day. Clearly something has changed with the food and it is not for the better. DO NOT BUY THIS FOOD.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Dunham

customer_reviews.title: Good batches so far
customer_reviews.text: Price is comparable to pet stores, but Amazon delivers to my door, so I order online for the convenience. I haven't had a bad batch delivered yet, so things are ok here. My cats are happy and healthy eating this, though I wish the shape was more spherical than triangular. They get caught in the automatic feeder sometimes...
customer_reviews.author: Harry L

customer_reviews.title: Misleading advertising
customer_reviews.text: So misleading! We have purchased this brand forever! Our cat is very particular and would only eat the little round discs (as shown in the description of the food). She has eaten this food since a kitten and transitioned to the “adult” formula after she turned a year old. I purchased another bag when she needed more food and to my surprise, found the food had changed! She will NOT touch the stuff! She is seriously protesting eating her food (been a few days now...) because of the change. Why change something so drastically?!?
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay DeMoss

customer_reviews.title: made my cat sick
customer_reviews.text: I’m extremely disappointed with this product. This food made my cat extremely sick. She would not stop throwing up and her fur starting falling. I switched her to another brand and all issues stopped.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: my cats can't stomach it
customer_reviews.text: My cats are 13 and older and indoor exclusively, but this food makes them throw up. They are now om the sensitive stomach and 4 way split q can of Friskies chicken and turkey, liver, or tuna (love Captain's choice pate when I can find any) no so much the shreds or filets. Gave last two bags of this indoor adult to the Cattery. Same problem now with the weight control. So my two tabby babies have started getting fat, but my other two healthier.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Tarvin

customer_reviews.title: Our cats love this food!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent food if you have a picky eater. One of my cats refused to eat any kind of dry food after she’d had wet food as a young kitten. We got a small bag of this from the vet to try and she loved it. After using for a few months we noticed how beautiful and glossy her cost was...she’s 2 now and it’s obvious we give her high quality food. People comment all the time on how beautiful and healthy she looks. It’s the same story with my other cat...except for he will eat anything! We love knowing that they are getting excellent nutrition in this food.
customer_reviews.author: J. Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Pricy But Very Good For Our Cat
customer_reviews.text: Helps keep our cat healthy with no useless ingredients and the cat really likes this particular flavor. She’s a hourly eater so she snacks all day and night as well. About every forty five minutes to the hour. She is at her optimum weight so the eating all twenty four hours a day works for her metabolism. Otherwise we would have changed her eating habit long ago. Four Stars ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gunnar Vogtmann

customer_reviews.title: This is dog food, not cat food!
customer_reviews.text: The kibbles are substantially larger than advertised. According to the website they range from 8.4 mm - 9.5 mm. I measured several of the kibbles with a digital caliper and they ranged from 11.21 mm - 11.51. That’s approaching 1/2”! Way too big for a cat. Also, our cats instantly got sick when they began to eat this food (even though we followed the transition process the website recommended). They began to vomit, get diarrhea, and one got a runny nose.
customer_reviews.author: monolith177

customer_reviews.title: Throwing up after eating
customer_reviews.text: I switch to this food from kitten food. And YES I slowly change their food. Yet my cats have been throwing up every-time they eat. I was wondering if it’s because it’s too big, so i broke them into smaller pieces. STILL they threw up everytime they eat... i wouldnt recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves this
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit unusual in the large size of the kibble. But I like it because I put it in puzzle toys, to make cat "hunt" and work for her food. A bit of concern that the size makes it a choke hazard but probably too big for that, and it must be chewed, not just swallowed. Maybe it is intended to slow eating, which my puzzle feeders also accomplish. If I slow down the eating, there is no barfing. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Ski9

customer_reviews.title: Trust the reviews. Your cat will get sick.
customer_reviews.text: 5 days in on transitioning from the same brand kitten food to indoor adult and my cat is puking everywhere. She won't even finish eating. Switching brands immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Corbin

customer_reviews.title: Nothing like cleaning up orange cat vomit daily...
customer_reviews.text: I keep trying to give this "one more day, one more day" and the cats continue to throw up numerous times on a daily basis since we have switched to this food. It smells disgusting so I can't even touch the food without hand sanitizer on standby. I loved Hills brand before so I'm hopeful this is just a bad choice of specific food for them.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Gleason

customer_reviews.title: Poor substitute for Ideal Balance
customer_reviews.text: My cat has some food sensitivity and I was so happy when we found Hill's Science Diet Ideal Balance. When that was discontinued and we switched to this line, our experience has been the complete opposite. The kibble size is significantly larger and my cat is reacting poorly to the food (watery eyes and frequent puking). I will be switching to another brand and do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cat food because I have 2 indoor cats -one is fat and the other (long hair) barfs at least once a week. Since using, the long hair cat has only barfed once in 2 months. That alone is worth it. The fat one is still fat. lol They seem to really like the taste. It's a little pricey, but when it lasts over a month, that's cheap to feed my babies.
customer_reviews.author: The Veget8r

customer_reviews.title: Your cats may love it, mine didn’t.
customer_reviews.text: My pets pick them out and won’t eat them. I tried to get them to eat it alone and they wouldn’t so I mixed it with different ones and they would pick these out each time. I was disappointed because there is one kind they did like until they changed the shape and they seemed more moist or oily. Will not spend that much again.
customer_reviews.author: ACarter

customer_reviews.title: Hill's Cat Food
customer_reviews.text: I love this food. I have given it to my cats for years. Their coats are shinny and very soft. My vet recommends this food and i am very happy with it. I recommend it to all my friends with pets.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Not for my cats
customer_reviews.text: This made both my cats so sick and the puked every time they ate it.
customer_reviews.author: Solange Adams

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE OF THIS FOOD
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my indoor cats thinking that Hill's was quality food. Both indoor cats threw it up so rather than return it I decided to put it our for the ferals. I feed them daily a cheap food I get from Sams. I just went out front to add some chicken to the pan and more throw up!!!! I'm pulling the food and trashing it. Something is wrong with this food. It might be tainted!!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie A. Ferris

customer_reviews.title: Cat's happy mom's happy
customer_reviews.text: He gets so excited to eat, he hardly chews his food. He slows down just enough to chew a bit more to enjoy it, so he's less likely to throw it up (whole)... Which tends to happen when he can't control himself. We use an automatic feeder so he's not throwing up/biting us begging every time we're near the bowl. The pieces fit through the PetSafe feeder great! No complaints here!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Crane

customer_reviews.title: Shiny coats, long happy lives
customer_reviews.text: Literally the best cat food on the market. I’ve been feeding this to my babies since they reached adulthood and I swear, they have shinier coats than any cat I’ve ever seen. My parents also buy this cat food for their two yellow tabbies, and they are living well into their golden years with no health problems. I swear it’s worth every penny! A bag the size lasts us about three months, even with two cats
customer_reviews.author: BWilson

customer_reviews.title: The Cats Love It
customer_reviews.text: I mix this with one of the other 'Adult' formulas and every time, they pick all of this out of the mix first, only eating the other once this is gone. I mix it because giving them just this kind caused my younger cat to bloat and become constipated, probably because he doesn't tend to drink as much water as my other cat. Anyway, they'd eat this all day if I let them.
customer_reviews.author: xlntgaltw

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my cats healthy
customer_reviews.text: I switched to this cat food after a bag experience with meow mix. My 3 cats were having very loose, smelly stools. I googled best cat food, and Hills Science was at the to of the list so I bought it. I've been thrilled so far. Totally took care of the horrible stink and I know that they must be feeling better too.
customer_reviews.author: HowzaMama

customer_reviews.title: Made my cats sick
customer_reviews.text: This food made both of my cats throw up constantly. I have seen other reviews were owners have said the same thing about this food making their cats sick. I am unsure about what in it makes them sick, but it is worth looking into.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best Kitten Food
customer_reviews.text: This is the best quality kitten food I have found so far. It has all the elements needed for young kittens. Dry pieced of kibble are perfect smaller size designed for kittens. Bag is resalable and convenient to use. My mom's cat's just like my cats last year love this food.
customer_reviews.author: Maciej

customer_reviews.title: Way too big- and yucky?
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Pieces are so big only a Jaguar could chew them. I paid 20 bucks for my cat to refuse to eat these size ginormous pieces of cat food.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Kurutz

customer_reviews.title: Caused an allergic reaction
customer_reviews.text: My cat had an allergic reaction to this food. He had two different foods, so our vet suggested that we eliminate each food for a week or so to see which one was causing his rash and itching. This is the one that was the culprit. Unfortunately, we have 7/8 of a bag left and it is too late to return for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Chesbay

customer_reviews.title: Sensitive Stomachs Beware
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this food for my two cats based on the recommendation of our vet; we've had them on it for 3 months and have never cleaned up so much vomit - as if that is not bad enough, it is always neon orange and stains if you don't get it up immediately. Final straw was when my male cat spent three hours vomitting and dry heaving... we've switched back to Blue Buffalo. If your cats have sensitive stomachs, this is not the food for you.
customer_reviews.author: LonnyJ.

customer_reviews.title: Cat sick all the time
customer_reviews.text: Cat throws up almost every day on this food...switching back to old one and have a second unopened bag now going to waste. I'm wondering if it is a counterfeit like others have said. Hugely disappointed in Amazon if that is the case.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: cat throws up
customer_reviews.text: It was on the list of recommended cat foods from the vet. he liked it right away,but couldn't keep it down. was throwing up blood. going back to my own first choice, Nature's Promise.
customer_reviews.author: phyl scalzo

customer_reviews.title: Great for my big 1-year old Alphie cat!
customer_reviews.text: Finally. A dry food that my cat likes & doesn't mess up his digestive system. One-year old Alphie likes this stuff just fine & he's one finicky boy. Previously I'd purchased an expensive fish brand that he loved but wreaked havoc on his digestion. So, this is a great compromise. And, his litter box is much nicer to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Ariesman1620

customer_reviews.title: We will see
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this brand, however the adult kibble has much larger pieces than the kitten. Understandable considering kittens are smaller, the adult kibble is still rather large for a cat mouth. We shall see how this works for him now that he's transitioning to adult food.
customer_reviews.author: K.M

customer_reviews.title: Better than most foods
customer_reviews.text: Cat does better overall on this food. If I give her anything else her stools are messy. With this food she tends to eat less and is leaner.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C.

customer_reviews.title: Cats vomiting everywhere
customer_reviews.text: My cats were able to eat for about 2 weeks. After that, both cats would eat the food and within 5 minutes vomit up their entire stomachs trying to get rid of it. I mean their entire stomachs. We tested with other food to see if it was kitty flu but they never puked up the other food.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Smells Awful
customer_reviews.text: I have tried this several times over the years as I'm always being told this is the best! It is not. I had to throw this out back to the critters. When I opened this bag it smelled odd ... just like the bags before. Could not get 1 out of 5 cats to eat it!! So this will be my last attempt at Science Diet!
customer_reviews.author: Tauni

customer_reviews.title: Best Choice For A Healthy Cat
customer_reviews.text: This is high quality, scientifically sound food. I came to appreciate the Hills brand once I had elderly cats. Their prescription food kept them going. They lived to ages 18 and 20. Now it’s all I’ll feed my new young one. Her coat is beautiful and litter clean up is a snap. Pay for the good stuff and buy this food. You will not regret it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Neither of my cats had ever thrown up prior to trying this cat food. Now both of them do multiple times a day. The pieces are also enormous, way too big for your average house cat. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it says.
customer_reviews.text: It does not smell strongly at all. It makes their poops not near as smelly. And it keeps them extremely healthy with pretty coats.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi MD

customer_reviews.title: Company supports humane society
customer_reviews.text: When I adopted Jax he came with a 5# bag of Hills Science Diet which is what they fed him at the humane society. I also received a coupon in that bag for $5 off another bag so I bought more. Jax loves it and he is active and happy. No need to switch.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Milton-Voels

customer_reviews.title: Cat thrives on this food, and this is a great price!
customer_reviews.text: OK I rated scent a 3 because, what cat food smells good to humans? My 5 year old has been eating Hills since she was 6 weeks, and every annual vet visit I hear how shiny her coat his, clean white teeth, health happy kitty! And she still plays like a kitten :)
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Kitty love it
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this food. It’s her favorite time of the day when she gets this. She will literally try to bite the bag open to get more so we have to hide it from her. She just got a checkup at the vet and she is a completely healthy 4 year old kitty.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Cat's like it along side wet food
customer_reviews.text: The cats seem to like this product as well as wet food. Maybe they like the crunch option? We leave both out, but the dry does not seem to attract ants. It does not leave much of a smell, when i grab by hand to serve sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Bear

customer_reviews.title: Best food for felines.
customer_reviews.text: Since we started this our older cats (7 and 8 y/o) have lost weight and are more active. Our three younger cats are very healthy and very active. Will not use any other brand. On the subscribe and save program its much cheaper than from the pet store, which is where you can only purchase it other than the vet.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Van Tassell

customer_reviews.title: Kibbles too big!
customer_reviews.text: I graduallly switched my 5 year old cat to this diet due to a vet recommendation and she has only been throwing up more and now has no interest in this food. The kibbles are also way too big... looks 3x larger than old kibbles as if it were for a dog! I will be switching her back to Blue Buffalo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Food in Bag
customer_reviews.text: This is not the usual batch of this particular Science Diet product. Instead, the pieces of food are huge - comparable to dog food. My cats won’t touch the food. I didn’t get this returned to Amazon in time because I just opened the bag as my prior bag lasted until now. So, I lost a significant amount of money for nothing. BEWARE! BEWARE! BEWARE!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Great food!
customer_reviews.text: My cats absolutely love this food. It’s good on their stomachs, and overall they look and act healthy
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

customer_reviews.title: My cat is picky and she loves it
customer_reviews.text: The bag has a nice resealable closure to ensure freshness and longevity. My cat immediately munched down on these little gibblets, which is great considering that it is also one of the healthiest foods to feed your animal. I'm happy, the price is high, but comparable to lesser quality.
customer_reviews.author: derrick

customer_reviews.title: Questionable product...
customer_reviews.text: Had to take 1 1/2year old cat off this food. Made him start throwing up here & there over time. May be just my cat, but for as young as he is seems pretty fishy to me. Went to a grain free diet.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: You can't convince me to change
customer_reviews.text: Science diet is one of the most respected, balanced brands out there. My childhood dog had it her whole life and lived to the ripe age of 17. I currently use the indoor brand for my two cats, who came from shelters (both of which stay inside due to my relocation to a city) and in the 2 years I've had my fur children, I've seen an immense change from malnutrition to happy, healthy babies with beautiful, lustrous, coats. They have both received rave reviews from their veterinarian in regards to healthy skin, nails, weight, teeth, and hair. I am unwaveringly loyal to this brand!
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlin Brown

customer_reviews.title: Cancelation and pick up is needed.....
customer_reviews.text: I do not need the cat food. I have previously canceled the order I have cat food running out my ears. I want a total refund for the 15.5 lbs and the 7.0 lbs from this order. I also have 7.0lb from a previous order. Help. Do not use my credit card to keep charging me for a order that is canceled. Help Help Help
customer_reviews.author: fleeta tate

customer_reviews.title: Chungus Amongus to Average Weight in a Few Months
customer_reviews.text: My hambs were chungus amongus. My bongo-bellied felines were turning into bowling balls so I bought this food. It's only been a few months and they've lost a lot of weight and are moving around so much more. At least they we're thrilled to go from Meow Mix type garbage to the Hills Diet, but slowly got adjusted. I'm happy I made the switch even if it took an extra ding to the wallet because they are so much healthier already.
customer_reviews.author: Annamarie Botsch

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: We were using blue buffalo for a long time and the cats just loved it but we’re gaining sooooo much weight. This has been a perfect diet food alternative and has allows them to loose a significant amount of weight.
customer_reviews.author: Jaycee

customer_reviews.title: Made both cats sick
customer_reviews.text: Both of my cats have been puking every day this week. This is the third bag I have bought. I won’t make the mistake of buying again. Going to get them something new tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Steff

customer_reviews.title: She likes it, But the Kibble is too big.
customer_reviews.text: I buy food to tailor to each of our cats needs. This was purchased for our 2 year old female calico. Occasionally, we'll catch the other two cats trying to eat her food, so we know it's good. She barely eats it though. We believe it's because the pellets/kibble/food (whatever you want to call it) are so large, it's difficult for her. She's petite. We're going to try the Optimal Care by Science Diet as soon as this bag is finished. If I could critique this food: Make the kibble smaller, and we'll come back to this particular selection.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Mergel

customer_reviews.title: Not A Favorite . . .
customer_reviews.text: Have two adult indoor cats that have traditionally eaten Hill's Science Diet Feline Adult Optimal Care. Thought I would try an "Indoor" food . . . First, the kibble size is huge compared to Adult Optimal Care kibble; Second, while they somewhat begrudgingly ate it - It was clear that this was not a favorite. Went back to to the Hill's Adult Optimal Care and everyone is purr-fectly happy once again.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Hula

customer_reviews.title: My cats love this food
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this food. I switched from a grocery store brand because their coats looked dull and they were shedding more than shorthairs should. Normally when I change foods, I have to wean them on to the new brand over time, but they started eating this preferentially over the old brand on day 1. They even prefer this over canned food! Within weeks, their coats were shiny and the shedding was much less. My cat who is prone to regurgitation has done this somewhat less since starting on this food as well. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Laura6872

customer_reviews.title: My cats love this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: We're living in a town that doesn't have a Petco or Pet Smart so we have been ordering our food from amazon! We have two bengals and they love anything I've bought from science diet. My younger cat likes it so much he acts like he's burying it so no one will take it from him!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Layton

customer_reviews.title: I wanted quality food for my cats. This makes them sick.
customer_reviews.text: My cats hate this food. One of my cats throw up after eating it. What's worse is I meant to order one bag and ended up with two. Must have been a mistake because I never order more than one bag of something till I know if they like it.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: CAT
customer_reviews.text: CAT LIKES IT. It get him more energy. Feed your cat one can on tuna with out oil a week . I have other things , but this works best. Hes so healthy i did not even get the doctor to look at him during his shots. I will do so if he looks bad during the winter.
customer_reviews.author: HERE

customer_reviews.title: Only food I buy
customer_reviews.text: There are a million different pet foods out there but I have been feeding my cats Science Diet since its inception and my cats live full long healthy lives. Love the indoor variation as my cats don't go outside. Considering the daily energy levels of them, i'd say it's doing a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Free Scotland

customer_reviews.title: Science diet quality food
customer_reviews.text: Man, the freshness and tastiness of hill’s science diet cat food is beyond comparison. Like this cat food tastes like gourmet cuisine on par of that of fancy feast. My cat however, thinks that its just ‘ok’.
customer_reviews.author: ppak10

customer_reviews.title: Great food
customer_reviews.text: I really don’t want my cats getting fat so I give them this food and so far I’ve been able to maintain them at a healthy weight. They do cry for food as all cats do so I give them a little scoop as mini snacks when they cry, not all the time but occasionally. Just Incase they’re hungry
customer_reviews.author: lorena gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Its not real science diet food. Fake!
customer_reviews.text: It came in a hills science diet bag but this food is not the original product. I've been buying this food for years, this kibble is 3 times bigger than real product.
customer_reviews.author: stefan Metzger

customer_reviews.title: Cured my Cats Stomach Ailments
customer_reviews.text: Since switching over To Hill’s Science Diet, my one of my cats in particular has stopped vomiting almost completely. I’ve tried many different brands of cat food and she always profusely vomiting no matter what so the fact she’s almost stopped completely after switching to Hills is a triumph of its own right to the brand
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Sadie Jane loves it.
customer_reviews.text: We have a very finicky little girl; she only eats hard food and/or snacks. Then she's pretty finicky about which ones she'll eat. Luckily, she loves this food! As for the flavor, I really couldn't tell you; I haven't personally tried it.
customer_reviews.author: jojomorr

customer_reviews.title: Made 12 month old sick
customer_reviews.text: I started my cat on this food 1 tablespoon 2 x’s day for 4 days - all 4 days he vomited and was not himself.. Perhaps the kibbles are too big. I noticed in his litter box he had swallowed them without chewing. He is VERY ill from this food. Size? Bad batch? Not sure.
customer_reviews.author: Gramsx2

customer_reviews.title: NOT GOOD AT ANY PRICE
customer_reviews.text: first bags was good ,no problems. the 2nd one was terrible my cat got very sick vomiting never again
customer_reviews.author: Bubacat

customer_reviews.title: My 3 cats love it.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure about the flavor of the cat food, I never tasted it, but my cats seem to really like it. I have tried other cat food and some of them had such a strong odor I couldn't stand the smell. I had to feed them in an area where I couldn't smell it. My cats are healthy with nice shinny coats.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great brand, won’t purchase online again.
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure why but this food made my cat sick. He would throw up at least once a week. It had me wondering if maybe this food had been stored incorrectly or gotten too hot in shipping? I decided to purchase food from the same brand at our local pet store and he has been fine ever since. I won’t purchase cat food online again. Not worth the risk.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Shank

customer_reviews.title: Happy and Healthy Dumps.
customer_reviews.text: I don't think it tastes very good, but my cat likes this, and has 0 digestional issues. A big bag like this lasts for months for a single cat, so the price is negligible. I will gladly continue paying a bit extra for this brand to ensure she has happy and healthy dumps.
customer_reviews.author: Cornelius B. Willingston

customer_reviews.title: cats eat this food
customer_reviews.text: The cats do not have stomach distress with this food
customer_reviews.author: Cheri Doucette

customer_reviews.title: Buy a small bag first for your cat(s) to taste test
customer_reviews.text: I suggest buying the smallest bag first so you can determine if your cat(s) will eat it. I have 2 indoor cats who are not particularly finicky about what they eat. Neither would touch this. If I'd mix it w/other dry food, they'd mine "the good stuff" out and leave the Science Diet kibbles behind. One even sniffed and then "buried it"; i.e., the front paw action after using the litter box. Now, that tells me it must be pretty nasty to them! I finally gave up and donated the bag to a neighbor who feeds the feral cats who show up at her door.
customer_reviews.author: daisyjane

customer_reviews.title: Great Choice!
customer_reviews.text: Great Choice! My cat is 1 year old and had been on Hill’s Science Diet Kitten food for the past year. The minute I opened the bag and put in his dish he loved it. The ingredients are great for him. Thanks Hill’s!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Fox

customer_reviews.title: My adult cat doesn't like the flavor.
customer_reviews.text: My adult cat doesn't like the flavor. She prefers our senior cat's food, Purina Plus Senior Chicken. It does not flow well in our automatic feeder.
customer_reviews.author: nijimon

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Ordered
customer_reviews.text: Received the cat food very quickly and it appears fresh and ready to eat. I don't know about the flavor or smell as I haven't opened the food yet.
customer_reviews.author: Norm's mom

customer_reviews.title: Cats love this!
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying this for 7 years, and both our cats prefer it over their wet food. Their teeth are super healthy, as is their weight. And they have beautiful coats! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it
customer_reviews.text: I love science diet and when I don’t have time to run to my closest petco I order it here it’s also a big plus that I don’t have to carry it to the car
customer_reviews.author: Angela

product_meta.title: Hill's Science Diet Dry Cat Food, For Adult Indoor Cats, Chicken Recipe
product_meta.description:
Size:15.5 LBDuring your cat's adult years, You want to feed nutrition that supports everyday health and digestion. Hill's Science Diet indoor Adult Dry cat food is specially formulated to fuel the energy needs of cats with an indoor lifestyle During the prime of their life. Made for Grown cats, this pet food made with natural ingredients uses DHA from fish Oil to support Brain health and eye development. Balanced minerals promote strong teeth and bones, while natural fibers promote healthy digestion for young cats, and easier litter box cleanup for you. There’s more to love with the new look of science Diet. Some of our products also have new names, new kibble shapes & new formulas.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Hill’s Pet Nutrition’s Mission: To help enrich and lengthen the special relationships between people and their pets. 

More than 220 veterinarians, food scientists, technicians and Ph.D. nutritionists at Hill's develop all of Hill's pet foods to meet the needs of your pets. Hill’s only accepts ingredients from suppliers whose facilities meet stringent quality standards and who are approved by Hill's. Not only is each ingredient examined to ensure its safety, we also analyze each product's ingredient profile for essential nutrients to ensure your pet gets the stringent, precise formulation they need.

Hill’s uses only high-quality ingredients including real chicken, lamb or salmon protein. Hill’s dry pet foods have quality protein as the first ingredient and provide clinically proven antioxidant benefits. Plus, they’re made with natural ingredients (plus vitamins, minerals & amino acids) and never contain artificial colors, flavors, preservatives or chicken by-product meal.

Hill’s Food, Shelter & Love program donates food to shelters across the country, providing the proper nutrition that helps pets find their way to loving homes. With every purchase of Science Diet you help feed over 100,000 homeless pets every day, 365 days a year. Natural fiber supports digestive health and high-quality ingredients make litter box clean-up easy.
feature_bullets: Indoor adult dry cat food is specially formulated to fuel the energy needs of adult cats with an indoor lifestyle
Made with natural fibers to promote healthy digestion and easy litter box clean up
Uses quality protein and natural fibers to support your adult cat's hunger between meals
Give your kitty the variety they crave with Science Diet Adult Indoor Cat Ocean Fish Entrée
Made in the USA with global ingredients you can trust

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
